00044    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00045    class FArray 
00046    {
00047 
00048    public:
00049 
00053       FArray();
00054 
00060       FArray(const FArray<Data, Capacity>& other);
00061    
00069       FArray<Data, Capacity>& operator=(const FArray<Data, Capacity>& other);
00070 
00071       // Default destructor is okay.
00072 
00076       int size() const;
00077 
00081       int capacity() const;

00088       void begin(ArrayIterator<Data> &iterator);
00089

00103       Data& operator[] (int i);

00151    /*
00152    * Constructor.
00153    */
00154    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00155    FArray<Data, Capacity>::FArray()
00156    {}
00157 
00158    /*
00159    * Copy constructor.
00160    *
00161    *\param other the FArray to be copied.
00162    */
00163    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00164    FArray<Data, Capacity>::FArray(const FArray<Data, Capacity>& other) 
00165    {
00166       for (int i = 0; i < Capacity; ++i) {
00167          data_[i] = other.data_[i];
00168       }
00169    }
00170 
00171    /*
00172    * Assignment, element by element.
00173    *
00174    * Capacity of LHS FArray must be >= size of RHS FArray.
00175    *
00176    * \param other the RHS FArray 
00177    */
00178    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00179    FArray<Data, Capacity>& 
00180    FArray<Data, Capacity>::operator=(const FArray<Data, Capacity>& other) 
00181    {
00182 
00183       // Check for self assignment
00184       if (this == &other) return *this;
00185 
00186       // Copy elements
00187       for (int i = 0; i < Capacity; ++i) {
00188          data_[i] = other[i];
00189       }
00190       return *this;
00191    }
00192 
00193    // Default constructor is okay.
00194 
00195    /*
00196    * Return number of elements in this FArray.
00197    */
00198    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00199    inline int FArray<Data, Capacity>::size() const
00200    { return Capacity; }
00201 
00202    /*
00203    * Return number of elements in this FArray.
00204    */
00205    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00206    inline int FArray<Data, Capacity>::capacity() const
00207    { return Capacity; }
00208 
00209    /*
00210    * Set an ArrayIterator to the beginning of this Array.
00211    */
00212    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00213    inline void FArray<Data, Capacity>::begin(ArrayIterator<Data> &iterator)
00214    {
00215       iterator.setCurrent(data_);
00216       iterator.setEnd(data_ + Capacity);
00217    }
00218 
00219    /*
00220    * Set a ConstArrayIterator to the beginning of this Array.
00221    */
00222    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00223    inline void 
00224    FArray<Data, Capacity>::begin(ConstArrayIterator<Data> &iterator) const
00225    {
00226       iterator.setCurrent(data_);
00227       iterator.setEnd(data_ + Capacity);
00228    }
00229 
00230    /*
00231    * Mimic C array subscripting.
00232    */
00233    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00234    inline Data& FArray<Data, Capacity>::operator[] (int i)
00235    {
00236       assert(i < Capacity);
00237       assert(i >= 0);
00238       return data_[i];
00239    }
00240 
00241    /*
00242    * Mimic C array subscripting.
00243    */
00244    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00245    inline const Data& FArray<Data, Capacity>::operator[] (int i) const
00246    {
00247       assert(i < Capacity);
00248       assert(i >= 0 );
00249       return data_[i];
00250    }
00251 
00252    /*
00253    * Return pointer to underlying C array.
00254    */
00255    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00256    inline Data* FArray<Data, Capacity>::cArray()
00257    {  return data_; }
00258 
00259    /*
00260    * Return pointer to const to underlying C array.
00261    */
00262    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00263    const Data* FArray<Data, Capacity>::cArray() const
00264    {  return data_; }
00265 
00266    /*
00267    * Serialize a FArray to/from an Archive.
00268    */
00269    template <class Data, int Capacity>
00270    template <class Archive>
00271    void FArray<Data, Capacity>::serialize(Archive& ar, 
00272                                           const unsigned int version)
00273    {
00274       for (int i = 0; i < Capacity; ++i) {
00275          ar & data_[i];
00276       }
00277    }
00278 
00282    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00283    int FArray<Data, Capacity>::packedSize()
00284    {  return Capacity*sizeof(Data); }

00286    #ifdef UTIL_MPI
00287    /*
00288    * Commit associated MPI Datatype.
00289    */
00290    template <typename Data, int Capacity>
00291    void FArray<Data, Capacity>::commitMpiType() 
00292    {
00293       if (!MpiTraits< FArray<Data, Capacity > >::hasType) {
00294          MpiStructBuilder       builder;
00295          FArray<Data, Capacity> object;
00296    
00297          builder.setBase(&object);
00298          for (int i = 0; i < Capacity; ++i) {
00299             builder.addMember(&(object.data_[i]), MpiTraits<Data>::type);
00300          }
00301          builder.commit(MpiTraits< FArray<Data, Capacity> >::type);
00302          MpiTraits< FArray<Data, Capacity> >::hasType = true;
00303       }
00304    }
00305    #endif 
00306 } 
00307 #endif
